name: Hiroyuki Kitagawa
content: Hiroyuki Kitagawa, Dr. Sc. Japanese Version Here Hiroyuki Kitagawa, Dr. Sc. Profile Hiroyuki Kitagawa received the B.Sc. degree in physics and the M.Sc. and Dr.Sc. degrees in computer science, all from the University of Tokyo, in 1978, 1980, and 1987, respectively. He joined Institute of Information Sciences and Electronics, University of Tsukuba, in 1988. He is currently a Specially Appointed Professor at International Institute for Integrative Sleep Medicine, University of Tsukuba. He is also a Collaborative Fellow at Center for Computational Sciences, University of Tsukuba, a Visiting Professor at Kanazawa University, and an Invited Researcher at Intelligent Platforms Research Institute, National Institute of Advanced Industrial Science and Technology (AIST). His research interests include databases, data engineering, and big data: data mining, stream processing, sleep data analysis, information integration, information retrieval, and data analysis in medical and scientific domains. He is an IEICE Fellow and an IPSJ Fellow. Before joining University of Tsukuba, he was a research staff member in NEC Corporation, Tokyo. He was a visiting scholar of Carnegie Mellon University from 2001 to 2002, and of University of Maryland from 1984 to 1985. He served as Provost of Graduate School of Systems and Information Engineering, University of Tsukuba from April 2015 to March 2018, President of DBSJ (Database Society of Japan) from May 2014 to May 2016, Chairperson of ACM SIGMOD Japan Chapter from June 2003 to June 2007, Chairperson of the IEICE Special Interest Group on Data Engineering from May 1999 to May 2001, and an Associate Member of the Science Council of Japan from October 2011 to September 2023. He is a Senior member of IEEE, an Honorary member of DBSJ, and a member of ACM, Japan Society of Sleep Research, and JSSST (Japan Society for Software Science and Technology).
